00085 class FunctionParameterValueBase {
00086     public:
00087         /* I have to declare the getters and setters for every type of
00088            derived classes that will be instantiated. PITA.
00089            what's worse, i have to define no-ops as default implementation,
00090            because otherwise the templated derived class would remain
00091            abstract. that totally breaks type-safety during compilation.      */
00094         virtual void setValue(const double &) { }       
00095         virtual void setValue(const unsigned &) { }     
00096         virtual void setValue(const int &) { }          
00097         virtual void setValue(const std::string &) { }  
00098 
00099         virtual void setValue(const char *) = 0;
00100 
00101         virtual operator double() = 0;                  
00102         virtual operator unsigned() = 0;                
00103         virtual operator int() = 0;                     
00104         virtual operator std::string() = 0;             
00105 
00106         virtual std::string toString() = 0;             
00107     };
00108 
00110 
00121 template <typename T> class FunctionParameterValue:
00122         public FunctionParameterValueBase {
00123     public:
00124         FunctionParameterValue<T>(const T &_value): value(_value) { }
00125 
00127         virtual void setValue(const char *);
00128 
00134         virtual operator double() { return 0.; }
00135         virtual operator unsigned() { return 0; }
00136         virtual operator int() { return 0; }
00137         virtual operator std::string() { return ""; }
00138 
00139         virtual std::string toString() {
00140             std::ostringstream o;
00141             o << value << std::ends;
00142             return o.str();
00143         }
00144     private:
00145         T value;
00146 };

00168 class FunctionParameter {
00169     public:
00170         FunctionParameter(const std::string &_name,
00171                           const std::string &_description = ""):
00172             pImpl(new Impl(_name, _description)) {}
00173         ~FunctionParameter() { delete pImpl; }
00174 
00176         operator double() {
00177             return double(*(pImpl->value));
00178         }
00180         operator unsigned() { return (unsigned)(*(pImpl->value));}
00182         operator int() { return (int)(*(pImpl->value));}
00184         operator std::string() { return (std::string)(*(pImpl->value));}
00185 
00187         const std::string &getName() const { return pImpl->name; }
00189         void setName(const std::string &_name) { pImpl->name = _name; }
00191         const std::string &getDescription() const { return pImpl->description; }
00193         void setDescription(const std::string &_description) {
00194             pImpl->description = _description;
00195         }
00196 
00198 
00202         template<typename T> void setValue(FunctionParameterValue<T> *_value) {
00203             pImpl->value.reset(_value);
00204         }
00205 
00207         void setValue(std::string _value) {
00208             if (!pImpl->value.get()) {
00209 #               if 0
00210                 pImpl->value = std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase>(
00211                     new FunctionParameterValueBase(*pImpl->defaultValue));
00212 #               endif
00213             } else {
00214                 pImpl->value->setValue(_value.c_str());
00215             }
00216         }
00217 
00219 
00223         template<typename T> void setDefaultValue(
00224                 FunctionParameterValue<T> *_defaultValue) {
00225             pImpl->defaultValue.reset(_defaultValue);
00226         }
00227 
00228         FunctionParameterValueBase *value() const {
00229             return pImpl->value.get();
00230         }
00231         FunctionParameterValueBase *defaultValue() const {
00232             return pImpl->defaultValue.get();
00233         }
00234 
00235     private:
00236         //  these accessors are never used, but i like to keep them around
00237 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value() {
00238 //             return pImpl->value;
00239 //         }
00240 //         const std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value() const {
00241 //             return pImpl->value;
00242 //         }
00243 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue() {
00244 //             return pImpl->defaultValue;
00245 //         }
00246 
00248         struct Impl {
00249             Impl(const std::string &_name,
00250                           const std::string &_description = ""):
00251                     name(_name), description(_description), value(0),
00252                     defaultValue(0) {}
00253             ~Impl() { }
00254             std::string name;
00255             std::string description;
00256             std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value;
00257             std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue;
00258         };
00259         Impl *pImpl;
00260 };

00265 class ParameterFac {
00266     public:
00268         template <typename T>
00269                 FunctionParameter *createParameterWithValue(
00270                     const std::string &_name, const T &_value) {
00271             FunctionParameter *tmp = new FunctionParameter(_name);
00272             tmp->setValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_value));
00273 
00274             return tmp;
00275         }
00276 
00278         template <typename T>
00279                 FunctionParameter *createParameterWithDefault(
00280                     const std::string &_name, const T &_default,
00281                     const std::string &_description = "") {
00282             FunctionParameter *tmp = new FunctionParameter(_name, _description);
00283             tmp->setDefaultValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_default));
00284             tmp->setValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_default));
00285 
00286             return tmp;
00287         }
00288 };
